page.title: 18Coombe Country Park.
page.content: The park covers some 382 acres and is open from dawn to dusk throughout the year.The park is maintained by 5 Rangers and 1 Head Gardener.Its main uses are as a{Nature Reserve,}a site of{Special Scientific Interest}and for {Recreation.} There is a wide variety of wild animals and birds including most notably Muntjac Deer and the Hobby.Coombe Park has a lake which covers 86 acres and contains an important fishery,possibly the best in Great Britain.The arboretum has a collection of trees from all over the world,the oldest being an oak thought to be approximately 370 years old.Future plans are to open the whole park to the public and to create an agricultural experience of farming through the ages.
